**As a diamond/master tier Mordekaiser+Blitzcrank player and Dota2 player i have my own idea about what you can do**

-creep aggro
-base ad of marksmen
-reliability of melees

Sincerly

Definitely agree with the short list. Some of the other things that we need to make sure are that they can contribute to objectives (turrets, dragon etc) meaningfully in early/mid game, as well as scale up adequately with game length so that you're not gimping yourself if you take a melee bot into a ranged bot and lose when the game gets to 30 because they're able to take objectives faster. These are all just things on very long lists of problems we'll need to solve for it, but I'm excited.

Oh also, to your reply to me from a few days ago regarding nuanced decision making. This is one of the things that I didn't want to talk about then before this video, but this is one of the things that goes pretty hard in that regard (and that we're pretty excited about if we can do it). Taking a non traditional bot lane changes the way your entire team comp forms, the items you and your teammates buy, how you rotate around the map and all that jazz. I'll agree with your statement that at present there's certain aspects of it that are lacking, but as we investigate new runes and some of this meta breaking stuff I think we're going to get to a state that this is far more of a reality. Here's hoping it goes well.

You'll have to forgive my skepticism on the idea of bottom lane melee carries since the idea of a safe lane doesn't exist in League of Legends and never has. That's probably one of the very _few_ things that Defense of the Ancients does better than this game because you don't always need a ranged carry depending on your team comp. But of course, the only time melee carries seem to have existed in the pure "right click" form are either Master Yi or Tryndamere. I'll be watching your progress but I sure as all get-out won't be holding my breath.

We're definitely not looking at this as an easy thing to do, but I also don't think it's impossible. I'm also seeing a lot of people latching onto the idea we'll only be focusing on melee champs. My only issue is talking about the resolve tree and how they think people will be inherently less interested in it.
I've had suspicions for a while that Riot is inherently focused on damage and offense; this confirms it.

Now, is that a bad thing? Not entirely, but I would like a little more recognition for people who could care less about doing damage. I like tanking. If I play a tank and can win by keeping everyone else alive, I really don't care if I do damage.


~~Also, Yasuo came out in 2013? Still feels like he's a relatively new champ.~~

That's not how I interpreted the statement on resolve. I think what they're saying is that they've seen a trend in the player-base that people like to play high damage, flashy champions like Yasuo and Riven. 

What they were saying was that they still care about tank players, even though they are a minority of players. They're going to do what they can to make the runes more interesting for those players even though they think that's unlikely to make people want to be tank mains. 

If I'm interpreting your comments and their comments correctly, these changes are aimed at pleasing people like you. They want to help you by making those runes better.

Two points

I am will make my claim right now that whatever changes they make/add to resolve will ultimately be more offensive than defensive. 
Riot likes things to be active. That's fine, but they have yet to generate more than a handful of half decent ideas that are defensive in nature while still being active.

Second, I would question whether that is the naturally occurring nominal opinion or if preference for damage is merely an offshoot of offensive being more prevalent for the last several seasons.

Thing is, there's a multitude of viable (sub)classes in every lane but bot. Support, top and jungle can be anything from full tank to (almost) full damage. Mid is more damage oriented but dealing that damage can be done in a multitude of ways. And with reworked Galio you can even play a tank/ bruiser (depending on build) mid. Only botlane is **always** ranged (and in 80-90% of the cases also physical) damage mostly delivered through basic attacks.

My ideal solution would be to make marksmen more self-reliant but shave off a portion of their lategame damage.
to make melee work in bottom you are going to need to make this game a LOT more melee friendly from the bottom up.
